intro: Behen puberulus, commonly known as the hairy behen, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The hairy texture of its foliage is a distinguishing feature that aids in its identification.
